verses.verse: He cried <WH7121> also in my ears <WH241> with a loud <WH1419> voice <WH6963>, saying <WH559>, Cause them that have charge <WH6486> over the city <WH5892> to draw near <WH7126>, even every man <WH376> with his destroying <WH4892> weapon <WH3627> in his hand <WH3027>.

And <WH8337>, behold, six men <WH582> came <WH935> from the way <WH1870> of the higher <WH5945> gate <WH8179>, which lies <WH6437> toward the north <WH6828>, and every man <WH376> a slaughter <WH4660> weapon <WH3627> in his hand <WH3027>; and one <WH259> man <WH376> among <WH8432> them was clothed <WH3847> with linen <WH906>, with a writer <WH5608>'s inkhorn <WH7083> by his side <WH4975>: and they went in <WH935>, and stood <WH5975> beside <WH681> the bronze <WH5178> altar <WH4196>.

And the glory <WH3519> of the God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478> was gone up <WH5927> from the cherub <WH3742>, whereupon he was <WH4670>, to the threshold of the house <WH1004>. And he called <WH7121> to the man <WH376> clothed <WH3847> with linen <WH906>, which had the writer <WH5608>'s inkhorn <WH7083> by his side <WH4975>;

And the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> unto him <WH5674>, Go through the midst <WH8432> of the city <WH5892>, through the midst <WH8432> of Jerusalem <WH3389>, and set <WH8427> a mark <WH8420> upon the foreheads <WH4696> of the men <WH582> that sigh <WH584> and that cry <WH602> for all the abominations <WH8441> that be done <WH6213> in the midst there <WH8432>.

And to the others <WH428> he said <WH559> in my hearing <WH241>, Go <WH5674> you after <WH310> him through the city <WH5892>, and strike <WH5221>: let not your eye <WH5869> spare <WH2347>, neither have you pity <WH2550>:

Kill <WH2026> utterly <WH4889> old <WH2205> and young <WH970>, both maids <WH1330>, and little sons <WH2945>, and women <WH802>: but come not near <WH5066> any man <WH376> upon whom is the mark <WH8420>; and begin <WH2490> at my sanctuary <WH4720>. Then they began <WH2490> at the ancient <WH2205> men <WH582> which were before <WH6440> the house <WH1004>.

And he said <WH559> unto them <WH2930>, Defile the house <WH1004>, and fill <WH4390> the courts <WH2691> with the slain <WH2491>: go you forth <WH3318>. And they went forth <WH3318>, and killed <WH5221> in the city <WH5892>.

And it came to pass <WH5221>, while they were slaying them <WH7604>, and I was left, that I fell <WH5307> upon my face <WH6440>, and cried <WH2199>, and said <WH559>, Ah <WH162> Lord <WH136> God <WH3069>! will you destroy <WH7843> all the residue <WH7611> of Israel <WH3478> in your pouring out <WH8210> of your fury <WH2534> upon Jerusalem <WH3389>?

Then said <WH559> he unto me <WH5771>, The iniquity of the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478> and Judah <WH3063> is exceedingly <WH3966> great <WH1419>, and the land <WH776> is full <WH4390> of blood <WH1818>, and the city <WH5892> full <WH4390> of perverseness <WH4297>: for they say <WH559>, The Lord <WH3068> has forsaken <WH5800> the earth <WH776>, and the Lord <WH3068> sees not <WH7200>.
And as for me also <WH5869>, my eye shall not spare <WH2347>, neither will I have pity <WH2550>, but I will recompense <WH5414> their way <WH1870> upon their head <WH7218>.

And <WH376>, behold, the man clothed <WH3847> with linen <WH906>, which had the inkhorn <WH7083> by his side <WH4975>, reported <WH7725> the matter <WH1697>, saying <WH559>, I have done <WH6213> as you have commanded me <WH6680>.
